sec.p: Oils from the powdered seeds were extracted by hydrodistillation using a modified Clevenger apparatus by adopting method from Dua et al. [ 32]. In each case, 20 g of seed powder was distilled in 300 mL of distilled water in a 500 mL flask for 2 h. The entire sample of seed pod essential oils was extracted and collected in sanitized glass vials. Anhydrous sodium sulfate was used to remove water traces, and the A. nilotica seed pod essential oil samples were preserved at 4 Â°C for further experiments.
